Too many uptight or backwards people and people that take the game too seriously and resort to cheating. Its unfortunate the terrible sort of audience these Valve shooters tend to attract. In general the game feels a bit tone deaf as well, and lacks nearly all key WWII battles and instead simply has generic levels like "dod_berlin" "dod_flash" etc which just doesn't do it for me as a WWII history nut.

I've played a bit of this game but I think the well has run dry on it for me. I prefer Day of Infamy and Red Orchestra when it comes to online WWII shooters.

Oyunda normandiya çıkarmasından oslo harekatına kadar birçok tarihi konuyu ele alan harita mevcut.

Tek eksisi sovyetlet birliğinin olmaması.

Oyundaki devletler axis (naziler) ve allies(ingiltere ve amerika)

Oyunun artıları:

- sürekli respawn olduğunuzdan dolayı hiç sıkılmazsınız. 
- size atılan bombayı yerden alıp tekrar sahibine postalıyabilirsiniz.
attığınız bombayı takım arkadaşınızın kafasına çarptırıp kaskının düşmesine sebep olabilirsiniz.
- haritadaki hemen hemen her yer tanımlıdır. 
- ciddi bir takım oyunudur. tek başınıza şov yapıp bütün bayrakları ele geçirmeniz imkansız gibidir.
- düşmanı (ya da takım arkadaşınızı) silahın dipçiğiyle öldürebilirsiniz, kafasına kürekle vurabilirsiniz.

Легендарная игра Day Of Defeat про вторую мировую.Мне нравится эта игра,тем что в ней передана очень хорошо атмосфера войны,будто ты находишься на войне в тот момент.Очень ностальгическая игра,которою я всем советую купить.Правда сейчас в эту игру играют люди,но не так много как раньше.Эта игра,которая должна жить вечно.

The legendary Day Of Defeat game about the Second World War. I like this game because it conveys very well the atmosphere of war, as if you were at war at that moment. A very nostalgic game that I advise everyone to buy. The truth is that people play this game now but not as much as before. This is a game that should live forever.

Back in highschool 2006 i started playing this game on steam.
It was second FPS game what i ever got on my steam account back in the days.
What do i have to say about this game you may ask, well..
It's one of the best WW2 games out there, despite of Call of duty 1 & 2, this game had it all.
Main focus on capturing flags, not as a spawn point, but as conquering the whole map and winning the game.
I really put time on this game since it was only my second shooter what i had that time.
I used to play Counter-Strike but this game put Source Engine to the new level.
Controls are nice, gunplay is good and it was one of the first games where you could go prone if you wanted.
I miss these games where every loadout in different maps are different, like how in avalanche US has M1 Garand, M1 Carbine, M1A1 Thompson, Springfield, BAR, 30. Cal LMG, Bazooka etc And Axis has MP40, STG44, MG42, MG34, Kar98K with scope/ironsight, G43 semiauto rifle, Panzershrek.
In some maps you have instead of STG44 you have option to pick FG42 and sometimes even more different weaponloadout which is nice.

Sides what you can play as are US, British or Germany.
I think there might be mods for Soviets too.

Maps were nice, original maps like Avalance were my favorite, also the wintermaps were awesome.

I get goosebumps from the sound of artillery or when a grenade explodes in water, MG42's sound haunts me to this day.

TLDR; One of the best WWII games out there, littlebit arcady, easy to learn hard to master.
ps, don't blink, if you blink, you dead.

Surprisingly nice.
Although there are really only 2 servers with an active playerbase (10 and 20players), the game is not-to-be-refunded-after-2-hours worthy.
Although the textures and animations are dated, they can give a nice aesthetic to most people.
The playerbase seems to be mostly of ~26y. old men, which makes the game much more enjoyable, and even calming to play.
The only real downside is, unserprisingly, the Aussie part of it. (Get it? Down under?) The 2 servers give pretty high ping, although both servers are playable.

Overall, I would only buy this game full price if you're really into it. Otherwise, I'ld wait for a sale.



*Note: At the time of writing this review, I had not looked over the singleplayer part of it (If there is one, I don't know). So, keep that in mind.*
